thread.title: Liberty boys soccer's Colin Muller taking it to the next level, headed to Monmouth
thread.title_full: Liberty boys soccer's Colin Muller taking it to the next level, headed to Monmouth

title: Liberty boys soccer's Colin Muller taking it to the next level, headed to Monmouth
text:
Colin Muller (9) (lehighvalleylive.com file photo) By Kyle Craig | For lehighvalleylive.com on October 15, 2015 11:00 AM View/Post Comments 
Liberty High School ’s Colin Muller got a sense that big things could be in store for his soccer career last year. 
Muller made the top squad with Lehigh Valley United and realized that Division I contests could be in his future. 
“That gave me a ton of confidence and I just wanted to keep it going and take it to the next level,” said Muller, one of the Hurricanes’ senior captains. 
Fittingly, it was while playing with Lehigh Valley United at regional and national club tournaments over the summer that the All-State performer was noticed by Monmouth University’s coaching staff. 
Muller, a 2014 lehighvalleylive All-Area first-teamer, visited the beachside New Jersey school in August and has since committed to continue his soccer career with the Hawks in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference. 
RELATED : Liberty's boys soccer champs back in the spotlight, 40 years later 
“They’re good every year,” Muller said. “When I visited the school it was awesome and I loved it.” 
Muller’s father, Mike, is originally from Toms River, New Jersey, and introduced Monmouth as a possible option for the Hurricanes standout. 
Muller, who has 11 goals and eight assists this fall, was recruited directly by Hawks head coach Robert McCourt. 
“I thought he was a really nice guy and a cool coach,” Muller said. “He’s had a lot of success there.” 
McCourt has guided Monmouth to eight conference regular-season titles and five conference tournament crowns in his 12 seasons at the helm. 
The senior, who also considered James Madison University and Messiah College, has been a lynchpin of the Hurricanes midfield for a while now, but will likely become a central defender at the next level. 
Muller, who credited L.V. United coach Mike Gorni for positively influencing his game, has had some spot duty at center back for Liberty coach Jason Horvath this fall. 
Speaking of the Hurricanes, they’re 16-1 and recently beat Parkland for the first time since 2007. With one major decision out of the way, Muller is dialed-in on the large goals still ahead. 
“It’s a huge weight off my shoulders,” he said. “Now, I can just focus on playing the high school season, having fun, scoring and definitely winning.”
